entry.title: Time to get started on building this website

link.title: Time to get started on building this website

entry.content:
• Writing this first post after a while to get the hang of this.
  • While making the first post in over 4 years, I had to do some house cleaning.
  • Github now requires tokens instead of username/password.
  • I had to generate a new token to access the repository.
  • ChatGPT was very helpful for getting things started.
  • I learned how to use drafts.
  • All you need to do is to create a 'drafts' directory.
  • Then in the home directory, do 'bundle exec jekyll serve --drafts'
  • When I did this I came across some additional issues.
  • This involved the 'No Github API authentication' error.
  • This was easily fixed by adding 'github: [metadata]' to the 'config.yml' file.
  • I got an additional error for: 'jekyll 3.9.0 | Error: no implicit conversion of Hash into Integer'
  • This was resolved by executing 'bundle add webrick' (which is apparently to install a dependency missing from Ruby 3.0 or later)
  • Then 'bundle update github-pages' (to update all relevant gems)
  • Finally 'bundle exec jekyll serve --drafts' to see the results in 'localhost:4000/mm/dd/yyyy/_nameofpost_
entry.summary: Writing this first post after a while to get the hang of this. While making the first post in over 4 years, I had to do some house cleaning. Github now requires tokens instead of username/password. I had to generate a new token to access the repository. ChatGPT was very helpful for getting things started. I learned how to use drafts. All you need to do is to create a 'drafts' directory. Then in the home directory, do 'bundle exec jekyll serve --drafts' When I did this I came across some additional issues. This involved the 'No Github API authentication' error. This was easily fixed by adding 'github: [metadata]' to the 'config.yml' file. I got an additional error for: 'jekyll 3.9.0 | Error: no implicit conversion of Hash into Integer' This was resolved by executing 'bundle add webrick' (which is apparently to install a dependency missing from Ruby 3.0 or later) Then 'bundle update github-pages' (to update all relevant gems) Finally 'bundle exec jekyll serve --drafts' to see the results in 'localhost:4000/mm/dd/yyyy/_nameofpost_
